trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Subscription and Service Limits, Quotas, and Constraints
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Subscription and Service Limits, Quotas, and Constraints

trans-unit.source: Provides a list of common Azure subscription and service limits, quotas, and constraints. This includes information on how to increase limits along with maximum values.
trans-unit.target: Provides a list of common Azure subscription and service limits, quotas, and constraints. This includes information on how to increase limits along with maximum values.

trans-unit.source: This document specifies some of the most common Microsoft Azure limits.
trans-unit.target: This document specifies some of the most common Microsoft Azure limits.

trans-unit.source: Note that this does not currently cover all Azure services.
trans-unit.target: Note that this does not currently cover all Azure services.

trans-unit.source: Over time, these limits will be expanded and updated to cover more of the platform.
trans-unit.target: Over time, these limits will be expanded and updated to cover more of the platform.

trans-unit.source: If you want to raise the limit above the Default Limit, you can open an online customer support request at no charge.
trans-unit.target: If you want to raise the limit above the Default Limit, you can open an online customer support request at no charge.

trans-unit.source: The limits cannot be raised above the Maximum Limit value in the tables below.
trans-unit.target: The limits cannot be raised above the Maximum Limit value in the tables below.

trans-unit.source: If there is no Maximum Limit column, then the specified resource does not have adjustable limits.
trans-unit.target: If there is no Maximum Limit column, then the specified resource does not have adjustable limits.

trans-unit.source: It is now possible to combine multiple Azure resources in to a single Azure Resource Group.
trans-unit.target: It is now possible to combine multiple Azure resources in to a single Azure Resource Group.

trans-unit.source: When using Resource Groups, limits that once were global become managed at a regional level with the Azure Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: When using Resource Groups, limits that once were global become managed at a regional level with the Azure Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Azure Resource Groups, see <linkText>Using resource groups to manage your Azure resources</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Azure Resource Groups, see <linkText>Using resource groups to manage your Azure resources</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the limits below, a new table has been added to reflect any differences in limits when using the Azure Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: In the limits below, a new table has been added to reflect any differences in limits when using the Azure Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: For example, there is a Subscription Limits table and a Subscription Limits - Azure Resource Manager table.
trans-unit.target: For example, there is a Subscription Limits table and a Subscription Limits - Azure Resource Manager table.

trans-unit.source: When a limit applies to both scenarios, it is only shown in the first table.
trans-unit.target: When a limit applies to both scenarios, it is only shown in the first table.

trans-unit.source: Unless otherwise indicated, limits are global across all regions.
trans-unit.target: Unless otherwise indicated, limits are global across all regions.

trans-unit.source: It is important to emphasize that quotas for resources in Azure Resource Groups are per-region accessible by your subscription, and are not per-subscription, as the service management quotas are.
trans-unit.target: It is important to emphasize that quotas for resources in Azure Resource Groups are per-region accessible by your subscription, and are not per-subscription, as the service management quotas are.

trans-unit.source: Let's use core quotas as an example.
trans-unit.target: Let's use core quotas as an example.

trans-unit.source: If you need to request a quota increase with support for cores, you need to decide how many cores you want to use in which regions, and then make a specific request for Azure Resource Group core quotas for the amounts and regions that you want.
trans-unit.target: If you need to request a quota increase with support for cores, you need to decide how many cores you want to use in which regions, and then make a specific request for Azure Resource Group core quotas for the amounts and regions that you want.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, if you need to use 30 cores in West Europe to run your application there; you should specifically request 30 cores in West Europe.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, if you need to use 30 cores in West Europe to run your application there; you should specifically request 30 cores in West Europe.

trans-unit.source: But you will not have a core quota increase in any other region -- only West Europe will have the 30-core quota.
trans-unit.target: But you will not have a core quota increase in any other region -- only West Europe will have the 30-core quota.

trans-unit.source: As a result, you may find it useful to consider deciding what your Azure Resource Group quotas need to be for your workload in any one region, and request that amount in each region into which you are considering deployment.
trans-unit.target: As a result, you may find it useful to consider deciding what your Azure Resource Group quotas need to be for your workload in any one region, and request that amount in each region into which you are considering deployment.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>troubleshooting deployment issues</linkText><title></title> for more help discovering your current quotas for specific regions.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>troubleshooting deployment issues</linkText><title></title> for more help discovering your current quotas for specific regions.

trans-unit.source: The following limits apply when using the Azure Resource Manager and Azure Resource Groups.
trans-unit.target: The following limits apply when using the Azure Resource Manager and Azure Resource Groups.

trans-unit.source: Limits that have not changed with the Azure Resource Manager are not listed below.
trans-unit.target: Limits that have not changed with the Azure Resource Manager are not listed below.

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the previous table for those limits.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the previous table for those limits.

trans-unit.source: The following limits apply when using the Azure Resource Manager and Azure Resource Groups.
trans-unit.target: The following limits apply when using the Azure Resource Manager and Azure Resource Groups.

trans-unit.source: Limits that have not changed with the Azure Resource Manager are not listed below.
trans-unit.target: Limits that have not changed with the Azure Resource Manager are not listed below.

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the previous table for those limits.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the previous table for those limits.

trans-unit.source: For additional details on storage account limits, see <linkText>Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details on storage account limits, see <linkText>Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following App Service limits include limits for Web Apps, Mobile Apps, API Apps, and Logic Apps.
trans-unit.target: The following App Service limits include limits for Web Apps, Mobile Apps, API Apps, and Logic Apps.

trans-unit.source: For additional details on Azure Search limits, see <linkText>Limits and Constraints</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details on Azure Search limits, see <linkText>Limits and Constraints</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For SQL Database limits, see <linkText>SQL Database Resource Limits</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For SQL Database limits, see <linkText>SQL Database Resource Limits</linkText><title></title>.
